title: Mayor Wu announces new efforts to restrict ICE in Boston
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Mayor Michelle Wu signed an executive order barring ICE from using Boston city property for immigration enforcement.
The order requires local police to investigate federal agents for any city or state law violations.
Wu's directive aims to prepare for possible ICE surges, citing concerns over past federal actions in Minnesota and Maine.

title: Sing your praises for Drake with our Maye-inspired crossword and playlist
author: Peter Chianca and Kelly Chan
bullets: New England Patriots quarterback Drake Maye inspires a crossword puzzle and Spotify playlist on Boston.com.
The crossword includes song and album titles with 'may,' and the playlist features these and bonus tracks.
Fans show their support for Maye with T-shirts, renaming towns, and painting logos ahead of Super Bowl.

title: Robert Spillane: Tom Brady’s neutral Super Bowl pick ‘makes me sick’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Tom Brady's neutral stance on Super Bowl LX between the Patriots and Seahawks upset former teammates.
Robert Spillane expressed disappointment in Brady's comments, highlighting his status as a Patriots loyalist and Raiders owner.
Rob Gronkowski supported the Patriots openly, contrasting Brady's neutral position on the upcoming game.

title: Lawsuit against Tesla reveals harrowing 911 call as driver trapped in burning car
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Samuel Tremblett died in a burning Tesla after a crash on Route 138 in Easton, Massachusetts, in October 2025.
A lawsuit claims Tesla's electric door handles trapped Tremblett, preventing escape after the car burst into flames.
Tremblett's mother is suing Tesla for $25 million, citing wrongful death and defective vehicle design in the claim.

title: The 6 most romantic places in New England, according to Travel + Leisure
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Travel + Leisure names Boston Public Garden the most romantic spot in Massachusetts.
Isle au Haut in Maine is highlighted for its seclusion and charm as a romantic locale.
Mohegan Bluffs on Block Island offers dramatic views and a scenic stroll in Rhode Island.

title: Pickup left dangling off Zakim Bridge in early-morning crash
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: A pickup truck dangled off Zakim Bridge after the driver swerved to avoid a disabled vehicle Thursday morning.
Massachusetts State Police responded at 5:30 a.m., securing the truck with a heavy-duty tow rotator; no injuries reported.
The incident closed the right lane of I-93 northbound at Exit 19 from just before 7 a.m. to 8:10 a.m.

title: 2026 Super Bowl commercials: Watch all the ads from the big game
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Dunkin's 2026 Super Bowl ad features Ben Affleck directing '90s sitcom stars Jason Alexander, Jennifer Aniston, and Matt LeBlanc.
Amazon Alexa's Super Bowl ad stars Chris Hemsworth and Elsa Pataky, focusing on AI features of the new Alexa+ device.
Budweiser commemorates its 150th anniversary with a heartwarming ad featuring a Clydesdale foal and a bald eagle.

title: How much does Tom Brady’s lack of support for the Patriots in Super Bowl LX bother you?
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Tom Brady, a Raiders co-owner and Fox announcer, remains neutral on the Patriots-Seahawks Super Bowl LX matchup.
Former Patriots like Vince Wilfork and Rob Gronkowski express disappointment over Brady's lack of support for the Patriots.
Boston.com invites fans to share their reactions to Brady's neutral Super Bowl stance, possibly featuring responses in an upcoming article.

title: Hingham kids revive a lucky tradition on Patriots Way ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Hingham kids continue a tradition by posing under the Patriots Way sign before Super Bowl LX.
The photo-taking tradition started in 2017, coinciding with the Patriots' Super Bowl victory that year.
Neighborhood superstition suggests taking the photo could help the Patriots succeed in Super Bowl LX.

title: 5 best new restaurant openings and dining updates in Boston (Feb. 5, 2026)
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Nohri in Chinatown offers Nikkei cuisine with handrolls, ceviches, and tasting menu options at 5 Tyler St.
Novo Lantern on Washington St. serves handmade dumplings and wok-fried dishes in the South End.
Uptown Social in South End, opening early 2026, features Southern cuisine, craft cocktails, and live music.
